content: *k6 sl1 k1 repeat from * to end together make a treble_crochet st into the next st turn rnds 7 & 8 a *k7 sl1 repeat from * to end row 3 k to treble_crochet st k all 3 strands of the treble_crochet st together rnds 9 & 10 b *sl1 k7 repeat from * to end make treble_crochet st into the next st turn rnds 11 & 12 a *k1 sl1 k6 repeat from * to end row 4 p to treble_crochet st p all 3 strands of the treble_crochet st together rnds 13 & 14 b repeat rnds 9 & 10 make treble_crochet st into the next st turn rnds 15 & 16 a repeat rnds 7 & 8 rnds 17 & 18 b repeat rnds 5 & 6 repeat row 3 & 4 until you have 1 treble_crochet st at each end of rnds 19 & 20 a repeat rnds 3 & 4 the heel making sure to slip the last treble_crochet st back to rnds 21 & 22 b repeat rnds 1 & 2 the lhn before moving to the next instruction rnds 23 & 24 a *k3 sl1 k4 repeat from * to end next row -a k to treble_crochet st k all 3 strands of the treble_crochet st continue working in pattern until your foot together work across the 24 28 32 36 instep measures approximately 13 15 17 5 19 cm / stitches repeating the stitches below 5 6 6 75 7 5 or 6 7 7 5 8 5 cm / 2 25 2 75 3 note you will now begin working in the round again 3 25 short of your required total foot length ending after an b round next round -b from where yarn b is attached your note a good indication for the correct length to bor k all 3 strands of the treble_crochet st together then start working a shadow wrap heel is to try on the work across the heel in patterning from the foot and if it reaches the part where your foot next round of the pattern from where you left off meets your ankle at the front start the heel skip the first st on the first repeat as this stitch was used as the treble_crochet st rowrow and kades page 8 daedalus socks - dk pattern 5 leg about keeping pattern continuity work patterning in the kelly menzies aka rowrow and round until leg reaches your desired length ending kades is a knitwear designer after a round using yarn b cut yarn b from the north east of england 6 cuff she has designed patterns for the knitter magazine let s knit and knit now as well as numerous self- using yarn a only published designs set up round *k1tbl k1 repeat from * to end ribbing *k1 tbl p1 repeat from * to end you can find kelly mostly on youtube with her repeat ribbing for a further 7 rnds for shortie
